channel.title: Queens on Table41NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Queens on Table41NYC

item.title: Shanghai You Garden
item.description: Known for their XLBs, it was pretty darn tasty. They also have stinky tofu too and it’s all pretty cheap.

item.title: Pastrami Plaza
item.description: Pastrami was ok. It was moist yet tips were dry. Food was cheap though, so might be good for lazy dinners. They have other things.

item.title: Tamashii Ramen
item.description: Decent ramen noodles. Soup was a little salty. The egg was disappointing.

item.title: Ramen Shack
item.description: Decent ramen. Got some super fancy ramen, and it was fat. Not the best though and it’s in a not so great neighborhood.

item.title: Lucky Pizza
item.description: One word: cheap.

item.title: Casa Enrique
item.description: Michelin 1 star restaurant for Mexican. Place isn’t great, but it’s not bad. Tacos are WAY too pricey at $6 a piece for such a tiny thing.

item.title: Waheyo
item.description: Interesting Chipotle/Dos Toros style but feels a little more ghetto? Food was ok but cheap.

item.title: Jora
item.description: It was ok. Meat was overly chewy and tough. Price wasn’t too bad.

item.title: Pelicana Chicken
item.description: Korean wings. They have ice cream beer which was a gimmick. It’s mediocre at best. They do give you these finger “condom” looking things to handle the chicken.

item.title: Daly Pie
item.description: Got the rhubarb, and it was pretty good. I love them rhubarb pies.

item.title: ChaTime
item.description: Passion fruit green tea was just OK.

item.title: Kulu Desserts
item.description: It’s ok. Lots of durian stuff. Black sesame wasn’t that great.

item.title: Prince Tea House
item.description: Good crepes and milk tea. The decor is interesting here.

item.title: Clever Blend
item.description: Bagel was pretty bad. The toasted coconut cold brew wasn’t that good.

item.title: Birch Coffee
item.description: The cold brew was pretty good, and the Ethiopian beans were good too.

item.title: Happy Stony Noodle
item.description: Cheap. It’s ok beef noodle + stinky tofu. Beef noodle with mustard green was ok.

item.title: New May Wah 359
item.description: Taiwanese food. Rice cakes good. Everything else eh. Cash only. This place is PERMA closed.

item.title: Nan Xiang Xiao Long Bao
item.description: XLB was ok. Scallion cakes were good. Beef wrap was good. Cash only.

item.title: Pearls
item.description: Caribbean “pita” pocket stuff is pretty good. The chips with guac and shrimp +1.

item.title: Baroness Bar
item.description: Pretty good albeit expensive. The beer selection here is pretty good.

item.title: Burger Garage
item.description: Reminds me of Pops but more standard burgers. Still pretty good and not too pricey.

item.title: John Brown Smokehouse
item.description: For whatever reason, the brisket was dry even though it’s recommended by Yelpers. The pastrami was also dry and overly salty. Generally the BBQ was bad. Maybe it was just this one time, not sure.

item.title: Dutch Kills
item.description: Decent vibey bar similar to some LES places, but way out in Queens. But who knows maybe Long Island City might be the next spot after Williamsburg!
